Yesterday our campus community came together to take a public stand against hate. Check out Local Memphis' coverage of the event.

“Tennesseans are all sizes, all races, all religions, all genders, all ethnic persuasions. Among Tennesseans, which all of us are, there is no place for hate. There is no place for incivility, there is no place for lack of courtesy to each other,” UTHSC Chancellor Steve Schwab. https://news.uthsc.edu/uthsc-campus-community-stands-in-unity-against-hate/

Dr. Altha Stewart, associate professor of psychiatry at UTHSC, was among the first class of women admitted to Christian Brothers University in the 1970s. In 2018, she became the first African-American president of the American Psychiatric Association. This month, she sat down with Memphis Magazine to discuss the biggest psychiatric issues facing the 901. Check out the interview.
